title: CSV Injection at the CSV export feature

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
Hi there, I have find a way to bypass the mitigation done in [#72785](https://hackerone.com/reports/72785) and [#111192](https://hackerone.com/reports/111192).


What happens if an attacker creates a Ticket with the Tittle `":";-3+3+cmd|' /C calc'!D2`. The ; will break the field making excel think that there are two fields. Although, you are using "" to encapsulate a field and , to separate them, its possible to break one field in two.

Normal case:
`118470,333333,open,new,Denial of Service,2016-02-24 17:43:52 UTC,,,,,,perra,,no,,`

Case where the field is splitted:
`118555,"'"":"";-3+3+cmd|' /C calc'!D2",open,new,"Design Issue,Missing Best Practice",2016-02-24 19:31:14 UTC,,,,,,perra,,no,,`

Once the CSV is create excel will ignore the " and split the field into two by taking into account the ;.

I have tried in:

* Excel Office 2013 on W8.1
* Excel Office 2016 on windows 10
In all cases the code got executed. 


I attach one picture with the executed code.

To Reproduce the issue:

1- Create a Ticket with the following name `":";-3+3+cmd|' /C calc'!D2`. 
2- Export it to CSV
3- Open the CSV. Check attached picture to see the executed code.


If you have further question do not hesitate to ask me.

Best,
███████
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi there, I have find a way to bypass the mitigation done in #72785 and #111192.

What happens if an attacker creates a Ticket with the Tittle ":";-3+3+cmd|' /C calc'!D2. The ; will break the field making excel think that there are two fields. Although, you are using "" to encapsulate a field and , to separate them, its possible to break one field in two.

Normal case:
118470,333333,open,new,Denial of Service,2016-02-24 17:43:52 UTC,,,,,,perra,,no,,

Case where the field is splitted:
118555,"'"":"";-3+3+cmd|' /C calc'!D2",open,new,"Design Issue,Missing Best Practice",2016-02-24 19:31:14 UTC,,,,,,perra,,no,,

Once the CSV is create excel will ignore the " and split the field into two by taking into account the ;.

I have tried in:

  • Excel Office 2013 on W8.1
  • Excel Office 2016 on windows 10 In all cases the code got executed.

I attach one picture with the executed code.

To Reproduce the issue:

1- Create a Ticket with the following name ":";-3+3+cmd|' /C calc'!D2.
2- Export it to CSV
3- Open the CSV. Check attached picture to see the executed code.

If you have further question do not hesitate to ask me.

Best,
███████

activities.message:
Hi there,


I keep testing it in more computers friend and in just one it didn't work.

Worked:

* Excel Office 2013 on W8.1 (Spanish and English)

Didn't Work:

* Excel Office 2016 on windows 10 (A guy from Greece).

I think this last case is due to the configuration from the Excel, it could be the language or some configuration in character interpretation (like decimal, hundreds, etc).

Best,
██████

activities.message:
I've been able to reproduce this issue. Excel does show several "Security issue detected, do you really want to open cmd.exe?" warnings, however.

We're looking into a fix for this.
activities.markdown_message:
I've been able to reproduce this issue. Excel does show several "Security issue detected, do you really want to open cmd.exe?" warnings, however.

We're looking into a fix for this.

activities.message:
Thank you for the response. 

About the warning, you can read here in [OWASP](https://www.owasp.org/index.php/CSV_Excel_Macro_Injection) two reasons about why the warning is not a mitigation:

1. The user trusts the site that the content is coming from. 
2. The user assumes that it is only a csv file and that it won't contain functions or macro's and won't care about any warnings from Excel about potential malicious functionality in the file.

Good luck with the fix.
Best,
████████
activities.markdown_message:
Thank you for the response.

About the warning, you can read here in OWASP two reasons about why the warning is not a mitigation:

  1. The user trusts the site that the content is coming from.
  2. The user assumes that it is only a csv file and that it won't contain functions or macro's and won't care about any warnings from Excel about potential malicious functionality in the file.

Best,
████████

activities.message:
Hi ███,

While this is an interesting workaround to the CSV injection problem, this is not something that can be fixed as the problem lies in the nature of the CSV format and apps that consume them (and in this case, very specific versions of the apps). One can argue that you can just replace the pipe characters with something else, like an encoding or a different character, but this hack modifies original data and would also fail to fend against future versions of Excel where some other character has special meaning.

> 2. The user assumes that it is only a csv file and that it won't contain functions or macro's and won't care about any warnings from Excel about potential malicious functionality in the file.

Ignoring warnings about potential malicious functionality is reckless behavior. Warnings are put in place to mitigate risk; a user ignoring such warnings is accepting the potential risk. This is what Google has to say about the issue: https://sites.google.com/site/bughunteruniversity/nonvuln/csv-excel-formula-injection

One can argue that you can just replace the pipe characters with something else, like an encoding or a different character, but this hack modifies original data and would also fail to fend against future versions of Excel where some other character has special meaning.

  1. The user assumes that it is only a csv file and that it won't contain functions or macro's and won't care about any warnings from Excel about potential malicious functionality in the file.

Ignoring warnings about potential malicious functionality is reckless behavior. Warnings are put in place to mitigate risk; a user ignoring such warnings is accepting the potential risk. This is what Google has to say about the issue: https://sites.google.com/site/bughunteruniversity/nonvuln/csv-excel-formula-injection

activities.message:
The reports you mentioned are not the same; although similar, they differ in that
1) they do not trigger a warning in the client app
2) the fix is within our control
The issue you've described here is unexpected behavior in Excel. CSV files should not be opened with `|` automatically interpreted as a delimiter (CSV = *Comma* Separated Values after all). We would encourage you to raise your concerns with Microsoft if that is possible.
activities.markdown_message:
The reports you mentioned are not the same; although similar, they differ in that
1) they do not trigger a warning in the client app
2) the fix is within our control
The issue you've described here is unexpected behavior in Excel. CSV files should not be opened with | automatically interpreted as a delimiter (CSV = Comma Separated Values after all). We would encourage you to raise your concerns with Microsoft if that is possible.

activities.message:
Hello @andrewone ,

Thanks you for the answer.

If you see the comment of the report [#72785](https://hackerone.com/reports/72785) (the first report that talks about this kind of issue) you will see that he mentions the warning. 

You can see it there https://hackerone.com/reports/72785#activity-494163. Despite the fact that it launch a warning  you considerated as valid. 

I have tested this issue with the `;` in other applications that export to CSV and it didn't work. The `;` didn't affected the number of.columns neither executed the code. I would say that they didn't even encoded the `;`.  I think that the `""` followed by the `;` produced this behavior.

I could do further test in those apps to see what are they doing. If you want.

Best,
████

activities.message:
Hi @███,

As I had explained previously, the issue here is a limitation of the CSV file format and not a result of our export. The only "fix" would be to remove the offending characters, which would be undesirably modifying original data. We could also export in `.xlsx` format instead of `.csv` but there are still strong use cases for supporting CSV. Upon discussion with our team, we've decided this is not an area that deserves further attention and have thereby removed it from our program scope.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @███,

As I had explained previously, the issue here is a limitation of the CSV file format and not a result of our export. The only "fix" would be to remove the offending characters, which would be undesirably modifying original data. We could also export in .xlsx format instead of .csv but there are still strong use cases for supporting CSV. Upon discussion with our team, we've decided this is not an area that deserves further attention and have thereby removed it from our program scope.

activities.message:
Thank you for the answer.

Best,

activities.message:
@███████ -- you are completely correct, and I apologize for the delay in getting back to you. I will award you the same bounty shortly.

I can't seem to reopen this issue and resolve it since it's already publicly disclosed, but I will get that fixed shortly as well so that you earn reputation.

Again, sorry for the problem here. In the future, you can always click on "Request mediation", which will go into a special queue that is more likely to be noticed in all the noise.

activities.message: Thanks again for the very detailed report. As previously discussed, we have removed this issue from our scope and will not be fixing it. However, as it was in scope at the time of your report, we will pay a bounty based on the issue.

What I can do though is to redact your name from the report - let me know if there's anything you'd like us to redact that might indicate your identity.

activities.message:
Since bug bounty is currently not allowed in my company, they will see this disclosure it will generate questions on my company side that could cause troubles if they don't understand that this is an old report and not a recent one. 

That's why I'm asking you not to disclose this report that it has no value for the community since these issues are no longer accepted by almost any bug bounty program. Removing the screenshots and the comments nay help, but if they check my account they know it's mine. 

Thanks in advance.
